page.title: 01Overview of Haverfordwest
page.content: This small market town of some 11000 people, is situated on the banks of the Western Cleddau and is roughly in the centre of the old county of Pemrokeshire now part of Dyfed. The town exists mainly to serve as an administrative and commercial centre for the surrounding rural area and has, therefore, many banks, offices, various services H.Q's, with a sprinkling of agricultural merchants and engineers. There is also a weekly cattle market which is quite large and reflects the largely livestock farming of the area. There are also a number of auctioneers offices with a large part of their business from farming. With much recent building for residential use and developments such as the new covered market and pedestrianisation the town is changing rapidly.
